post:
I have ONE bedroom open in my North Beach top floor apartment available on November 1st (no couples or pets). Looking for a mid to late twenties F, preferably. 
About the apartment: 
-$1475/month plus security deposit of $1525 (half of the entire apartment's rent) 
-PG&E can range from $40-$100 a month depending on season (split equally)
-Xfinity is $112 a month (split equally)
-approximately 750 sq ft flat style apartment w/ 2 bedrooms and 1 bathroom
-unfurnished room w/ closet (my current roommate is willing to sell her bed, dresser, and desk to whoever moves in if you’re interested)
-comfortable and furnished living room and kitchen
-great natural light in bedroom and entire apartment
-classic white walls and wooden floors throughout
-shared closet in the hallway
-no washer and dryer, but laundromats and delivery services are nearby and available
-street parking 
-directly next to Washington Square Park and Tony's Pizza, 10 minute walk to Polk Street, close to bars like Tupelo and Maggie's 
-move in date November 1st!
About me: 
F in late twenties, works hybrid in tech, lived in SF for 5 years, lived in this apartment for 3 years, clean and considerate roommate, outgoing and laid back, enjoys being active and having fun with friends, during the week I like to have a balance between staying in and maintaining a routine while also having a social life with friends, on the weekend I can be found at a cute bar enjoying a nice cocktail or going on a coastal hike across the bridge.
About you (hopefully!): 
F in mid to late twenties, very clean, organized, stable income, chill and easy going, open to being friends with roommates but also alright with mutual respect cohabiting, considerate and mindful, kind and inclusive. Overall, I'm looking for a person who will respect the apartment and care after it like it is your own. I'd like for my future roommate to have a solid routine with work and their personal life and keeps common places like the living room, kitchen, and bathroom tidy. Send me a message with your LinkedIn/Social Media profiles and I will be in touch!
author: Savannah Hair

post:
Furnished 1,149 Sq Ft. Apartment | 4 guests | 2 beds | 1 bath | $3950 month
Beautiful views across the San Francisco bay awaits you at this fabulous large 1 bedroom apartment. Stylishly furnished with a loft style lay-out provides views from all parts of the open space living area. Centrally-located in Russian Hill two blocks from famous Lombard St. and easy walking distance to North Beach, Chinatown, Ghirardelli Square and Polk Street with plethora of amazing restaurants and nightlife. Perfect for business trips, conferences or couples vacations.
The space
Large living, dining space and kitchen. There is one dedicated bedroom with a Queen Bed. In the living area there is a King Sized Day Bed that can be used for additional sleeping. It comes with linens. There's a drape between the Dining area and the day bed for added privacy if needed.

post:
Hi, we are looking to fill an open spot in our 4bed/2bath apartment in the Mission, on the corner of Florida and 21st St. Move in Oct 1st. Rent is $1450. Willing to stay at least six months
Feel free to DM for more info, video tour, or a video call with all of us
Info about the apartment:
- 4B/2BR
- Large living room/kitchen area
- Backyard with fire pit
- Washer/dryer on site
- Free street parking around
- Dolores Park and Valencia St <1mi away
- Garage for gear storage 
- Easy access to 101 and tech shuttles for commuting to South & East Bay (2 of us do it)
Info about the room:
- $1450 and ~$100 utilities/mo
- largest room in the apartment (~180sq ft)
- Bay windows — gets a lot of light
- Can stay partially furnished (bed frame, dresser, wardrobe)
- Security deposit is one months rent 
Info about the roommates:
- 3 guys in their mid 20s who work mostly in person, with a few days from home
- Pretty active — enjoy working out, hiking, camping, skiing and cycling
- Looking for someone fairly social, respectful pretty clean. Also around the same age

post:
Hi,
I’m looking for one person to sublet a private single room in a 2 Bedroom 1 Bathroom apartment in Inner Sunset from the start of October to the end of March (flexible on end date). I would be in the other bedroom and am an early 20’s guy working in marketing, but I am open to living with whoever.
Your portion of rent would be $1200 a month and utilities (PGE and Internet) are usually between $50 and $100 per person.
The apartment address is 1232 6th Avenue which is located right on the edge of Golden Gate Park and Irving street. The N Judah line is about a 2 minute walk and so are a couple different buses. Immediate area (2 minute walk) has a lot of shops and restaurants, and you can also get downtown very easily. Usually takes around 20 minutes to get from here to Union Square on the N Judah for reference.
The house itself has 2 bedrooms located on opposite ends, a bathroom, a kitchen, a living room, and a nice backyard. Your room is currently furnished with a bed frame and mattress. There is also a desk and chair you can use.
Please reach out if you are interested or have any questions, thanks!
author: Miles Driver

post:

About: Luxurious, rarely available corner unit condo featuring high ceilings with extra large patio! Tastefully renovated home with modern wood flooring, upgraded kitchen with waterfall island, quartz countertops and stainless steel appliances. Designer upgrades in bathrooms with quartz countertops and contemporary hardware. Spacious bedroom with two large closets. Washer/dryer in-unit. Deeded 1 car parking. Convenient location, close to Highway 101 and the Caltrain Station providing easy access to SF Downtown, Airport & the Peninsula. Free shuttle to BART Station. Gated community with 247 security. HOA Amenities include: Gym, guest parking, BBQ area and free commuter shuttle service. Also pet friendly neighborhood.
Send me a message for more details.

The kitchen has a dishwasher, garbage disposal, and real stone countertops. The bathroom has ample storage space, real stone countertops, and excellent water pressure.

post:
I have a room opening up in my 2BR/1BATH Noe Valley apartment!
The unit is on the top floor of a four-unit building with hardwood floors, LOTS of light, and in-unit laundry. There’s also a large outdoor patio space that is shared with the other units--the neighbors are great 
The room is $1925/mo, with the option to add a one-car garage at extra cost. The bedroom has two private closets and a large window with top floor privacy on a tree lined street. The living room is furnished and the kitchen is stocked — the bedroom furniture is for sale as well if interested. If not it will be removed 
Start date is flexible, but ideally Oct 1 or sooner. End date is also flexible; I am finishing out a lease that becomes month-to-month in January, so you could either move on at that time or take over the lease.
Singletons or couples are welcome. Happy to provide more information to anyone who’s interested!

post:
Looking for a roommate to fill a master bedroom for $1800/month in a 3 bed 2 bath apartment right off of Golden Gate Park and Geary Avenue. Super cute coffee shop around the corner, 5-10 minute walks to the 5, 31 and 38 buses, and local parks nearby! Rent is month to month, but would prefer someone who could commit for a longer period of time.
Room for rent is a master bedroom with its own bathroom. Bedroom is unfurnished, but the rest of the apartment already is. Shared spaces include a spacious and open living-room and kitchen with most of the necessary amenities. A bi-monthly garage space is available for an extra $100, but street parking is relatively easy and there are no two-hour parking limits nearby. Otherwise the garage is available for storing anything.
Roommates are 2 males in their mid-twenties, working stable jobs in tech (but we’re not tech bros I swear).
Looking for a responsible roommate with a steady income to move in. No specific requirements for age or gender, just be cool and clean. Current credit report and proof of employment are required as part of your application as well.
Please get in contact if the Richmond has been calling your name, we’re available to set up apartment tours!

post:
$1,500 Amazing room in a completely renovated Russian Hill apartment
The apartment was gut renovated before we moved in so we have brand new hardwood floors, granite countertops, new bathroom, stainless steel appliances, dishwasher, and central heating. We also have our own private deck with a gorgeous view of the Golden Gate bridge - amazing for BBQs and fleet week. The room fits a queen bed and has a built-in desk area and closet, and will fit a dresser or chair. The apartment has plenty of storage. There is a large dining room and open floor plan to the living room. The bathroom is only shared with 1 other.
We're in an amazing location that has great restaurants down the street (Abrazo's, Swensen's Ice Cream, Ssal, Seven Hills), close to Polk street (far enough to avoid the noise), and walking distance to North Beach, Marina, Nob Hill etc. If you work downtown or the financial district, the bus stop is right behind us on Union street.
The room will be available beginning October 1st.
The roommates are male and in their late 20s and 30s. We enjoy going out, but mainly keep it low-key on the weekdays. It's a spacious apartment and we have plenty of shared space in the apartment as well. Send us a message to check it out in person.

author: Ali Khalili

post:
Hey there - my name is Daniel and I’m looking for either a large studio or room to rent starting December or January. I'm 31, work in mental health tech at a series C startup - mostly from home right now but we have a new office opening up soon.
I'm looking for a quiet, clean, and comfortable place to live. I have been in my current house for about 7 years, and can provide a letter of reference from my landlord if needed.
Ideally need a garage or gated side yard to park a motorcycle. 
I'm mature, respectful, mellow, extremely clean, communicative, and quiet. In my free time, I enjoy going to the park, getting some food, grabbing a beer and watching a game. I am an amateur film photographer, and am out of the house as much as possible.
I like to make some food and watch a show or movie in the weekday evenings - would love to live with someone(s) who wants to hang out, but also don’t not need to be best friends.
On weekends, I am typically out of the house for most of the day and night. Not a big partier at all, and DEFINITELY don't bring the party back home.
I have a super friendly, medium sized dog named Oliver, who is about 10 years old. He is 100% trained, fully house broken, loves his crate, and is with me most of the time anyways. He loves to cuddle on the couch (if you want him to) - he's a big lap dog and doesn't realize that he's not a little guy. Also, he is a certified and trained emotional support and therapy dog, and has all his paperwork if the landlord needs to see it.

post:
Subletting my furnished bedroom in Cole Valley from late November to the end of December
(Dates flexible)
Asking for $2100 per month but open to pro-rating/negotiating price
About the space:
It is a huge room in a 6B2B house two blocks away from the Golden Gate Park, the Panhandle, and the Mt. Sutro forest. The house is also just a block or two away from various bus stops as well as the N Muni line. It is still on a quiet street away from the traffic.
About the people:
You will share the house with 2 guys, 2 girls, and 1 non-binary person in their 20s. We are easy-going, social, clean and tidy, and respect each others’ privacy. The house is quiet most of the time but we do like to occasionally host movie nights, game nights, parties, and dinners. 
Amenities:
The room comes furnished with everything you see in the pictures. You will be using the upstairs bathroom but the downstairs one is available in case of emergencies. There is a in-unit washer and dryer. The kitchen has a dishwasher and is fully-stocked with most things you will need for cooking. Our street always has parking spots available and it doesn't have street cleaning so you never have to move your car! We have cleaners who come every 2 weeks to clean the common areas!

post:
Hey everyone! Looking for someone to take over the master bedroom lease in a 2B2B apartment in Mission Bay, SF. I'm the current occupant of master bedroom and need to leave SF for compelling family reasons
About the apartment:
- Large 2B2B (~1200 sq ft) in a 16 story apartment building in a very central location in Mission Bay. The apartment is on the 13th floor with amazing views of the city and the sea
- Spacious rooms with lots of sunlight, large kitchen and living area; master bedroom has a large walk-in closet and attached bath
- Balcony with great views and breeze
- In-unit washer & dryer; in-room heating
- Community facilities including fully functional gym, club house, BBQ pits, heated swimming pool and jacuzzi
- 3min walk to Safeway, 5min walk to Embarcadero, 5 min walk to Mission Bay park
- 1min walk to bus stop that connects to everywhere in the city, 4min walk to Caltrain station, 10min bus ride to FiDi and downtown
About the other occupant:
I'm in my early 30s, MBA, working as a management consultant. I love playing sports, board games, exploring restaurants and generally being outdoors. I'm a vegetarian and I value cleanliness
Rental details:
- Rent portion for master bedroom: ~$2,275 (excl utilities). Negotiated down from ~$2500
- Utilities: ~$150 per person
- Deposit: 1 month rent
- Move-in date: flexible, starting Oct 20
- Lease ends: 31 July 2024, with option for renewal
- Parking: $250 (optional, currently we did not take it)

post:
Looking for a third housemate for our 3b/2ba apartment in Ashbury Heights! Our current housemate is moving out at the end of the month, so we’re looking for a 3rd housemate to join us in our Ashbury Heights apartment. The rent would be $1,550 ($4750/month total) with utilities totaling about $125/month. The security deposit is $2375. The lease is currently month to month, but we’d like for someone to be here for a longer term. Move in date would be Nov. 1, but could accommodate a few days earlier! Unfortunately, pets are not allowed. 
Features:
Stainless Steel Appliances
Dish Washer
In unit washer + dryer
Central 
Double paned windows
Hard floors/tile in common areas
10 foot ceilings
Great views! You can see the ocean and all the way to the east bay
Plenty of street parking 
Muni stops for the 37 and 33 just outside the apartment
10 min walk to Cole Valley and the Castro neighborhoods and muni stops 
Variety of streaming options (hulu, Max, apple tv+, disney+, etc)
About the room: It is a spacious 11x14ft room with plenty of closet space. A large sliding glass door to a balcony provides the room with excellent light, especially in the morning. 
About you: You’d be a great fit if you have a stable job and income (WFH is okay!). Enjoys socializing but doesn’t bring the party home. Has similar living styles and habits 
About the current tenants: 
J (29, NB): Works on the public policy team for a nonprofit downtown. Currently working in the office TWR and at home on Mondays and Fridays. I'm from Nashville, Tennessee and have lived in San Francisco for the last 4 years. Before moving to SF, I lived in Santa Barbara for undergrad. Some of my interests include: public policy, urbanism, politics, fashion/styling, drag culture, video games, green spaces, parks, and museums. In my spare time, I'm usually hanging out with friends or my partner, going to the park, engaging in nightlife activities and other things going on in the city. 
O (25, M?): I work as a public sector consultant helping state governments implement health and human services projects. I work from home unless I am traveling which tends to happen a few times a quarter. I grew up in rural Colorado before going to college in rural New Hampshire, and I have been in San Francisco for 2 years. When I’m not trapped at my desk, I try to live an active life of running, swimming, skiing, hiking, biking, and any other activities my friends want to drag me to. I don’t drink, but love a good night out dancing. I also have a passion for languages and am a lifelong learner of Spanish, French, and Arabic. 
If this sounds like a good fit, feel free to send me a message with a little bit about you and we’ll reach out!

post:
TLDR: $1,286 room in lower haight available Nov 1 in 6bed2ba huge home
We’re 5 chill and responsible people (2 women 3 men, ages 28 to 39) looking for a 6th in our Haight Street apartment, 2 blocks off Duboce Park. We love our home and all get along and hang out together while also respecting individual space and time. There are 2 large common areas, large kitchen, 2 bathrooms, washer/dryer. The room in question has street facing windows, a lofted bed, and closet (see pictures). Move in preferred on November 1st with some flexibility. Long term (>12 months) roommate preferred. Landlord sadly doesn’t allow pets (except in the case of service animals per CA law). 
About Us: 
W (he,him - 39): Nerdy and cheesy psycholinguist with a love of the ocean whose favorite place to dance is the kitchen.
K (he,him - 35): Lover of movies and good conversation, dreamscape creator and musical facilitator, often out making magic for folks in the city and up and down the coast, with an infectious laugh. 
L (she, her - 33): Fried-food-lover and roller skater, equally likely to be found in front of Real Housewives or the DSM-5, who missed her calling as a personal stylist or interior designer.
B (she,her - 30): Get-it-done nurse who splits her time between SF and NY when not hopping over to Sweden for Beyoncé concerts.
E (he,him - 28): Explorer of restaurants and bars who loves finding a new SF staircase or alleyway and is silly to his core.
Now tell us about you! Please give us some census-style info (name, age, etc…) as well as your one-line intro, and answer the following questions (short answers please):
Why do you want to live with us?
What does a typical day look like for you?
When is the soonest that you are available to meet us? 
We are hoping to do interviews a.s.a.p. Looking forward to meeting you!

post:
Hello everyone! I am looking for two roommates for a just newly renovated, rent controlled, iconic apartment in Nob Hill/Russian Hill area right on Polk Street!
Address: 2355 Polk St
(99/100 walking score)
Rent: $2150 for the 322 sqft room, and $2050 for the 306 sqft room.
I have toured the place personally, and these rooms are truly gigantic! They are living-room sized rooms where you can fit a bed, a sofa, a desk, and probably most things you can think of. The house is very modern and just newly renovated, and it is one of the most iconic buildings in the neighborhood. In unit washer and dryer. The apartment is right across from Crunch fitness, and Polk Street is full of bars, cafes, and amazing restaurants - it's a truly lively vibe!
-Ghirardelli Square and the waterfront is also only a few minutes away.
-Walking distance from Trader Joe's and Whole Foods.
Feel free to DM me for additional details or if you want to stop by and check out the place!
